mn1:1.2: Two points: 1) The word for "time" can be *samay*, which is from Sanskrit or it can also be *vakhat*, which is also used in ordinary, daily language, whose root is from Urdu, *Vakht*. While not pure indic in its origin, *vakhat* has been used for a thousand year since the arab influence (invasion). 2) The word *bhagavaa* can be translated as *bhagavant*, *bhagavan*, or by *bhagavant Buddha* (similar to B. Sujato English translation). The point is in Gujarati and Hindi, the counterpart of just *buddha* cannot be used, it will always have to be prefaced by some *bhagava*-root word.
